it.unipr.netsec.mjcoap.coap.server

Class CoapServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.mjcoap.coap.server.AbstractCoapServer
      • it.unipr.netsec.mjcoap.coap.server.CoapServer

  • public class CoapServer
extends AbstractCoapServer
    Ready-to-use simple stateful CoAP server. It handles CoAP GET, PUT, and DELETE requests statefully, automatically handling request/response retransmissions.

    It supports resource observation (RFC 7641) and blockwise transfer (RFC 7959).

    Support of CoAP method POST can be easily added by extending this class and overriding the method AbstractCoapServer.handlePostRequest(CoapRequest) by adding the proper handling of POST requests.

    Local resources can be retrieved by remote clients by means of the CoAP GET method.

    If the server is in 'write-enabled' mode, resources can be also created, changed, and removed by remote clients by means of the CoAP PUT and DELETE methods. Uses the method setWriteMode(boolean) to activate the 'write-enabled' mode.

    Resources can be created, retrieved, changed, and deleted locally through the setResource(String,int,byte[]), getResourceValue(String), and getResourceFormat(String) methods.

    For example, in order to create a server and add a resource you can simply do: 

            CoapServer server = new CoapServer();
        server.setResource("/test",CoapResource.FORMAT_TEXT_PLAIN_UTF8,"Hello World!".getBytes());
